name: ExecutionMilestone
comment: Holds the milestone values for the overall execution project or plan, and plan activity. It also maintains the due dates for each activity or plan. There can be two types of milestones, Driving and Tracking. The Driving milestones are used to trigger or notify other process or system, whereas the Tracking milestones are used to track the progress.
vf short description: Holds the milestone values for the overall execution project or plan, and plan activity. It also maintains the due dates for each activity or plan. There can be two types of milestones, Driving and Tracking.

fields.name: ExecutionMilestoneSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: ExecutionMilestoneKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the milestone in aLDM. Milestone can be for a project, or for an activity. OSS_PROJECT_MILESTONE.OID//Generated based on Execution Milestone Id

fields.name: ExecutionPlanActivitySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ExecutionMilestoneTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ExecutionMilestoneStateSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ExecutionMilestoneId
fields.comment: Indicates a unique identifier at source. OSS_PROJECT_MILESTONE.OID

fields.name: BusinessId
fields.comment: Stores the business Id of the milestone. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.ID

fields.name: ExecutionPlanSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ActualStartDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which the milestone was started. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.ACTUAL_START

fields.name: PreviousMilestoneStateSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ActualEndDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which the milestone was completed. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.ACTUAL_END

fields.name: DueDate
fields.comment: Indicates ongoing calculated end date, which represents the time in which the milestone must be achieved. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.DUE_DATE

fields.name: PlannedStartDate
fields.comment: Indicates the calculated initial start date. This date represents the time in which the milestone must start. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.PLANNED_START_DATE

fields.name: PlannedEndDate
fields.comment: Indicates the calculated initial end date. This date represents the time in which the milestone must be achieved. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.PLANNED_END_DATE

fields.name: OssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the timestamp of last update. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.LAST_UPDATE

fields.name: EscalationLevel
fields.comment: Indicates the current escalation level ID. OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.ESCALATION_LEVEL

fields.name: StartDate
fields.comment: OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.START_DATE

fields.name: SpecId
fields.comment: OSS_SLM_MILESTONE.SPEC_ID

fields.name: ExecutionMilestoneName
fields.comment: select B.ENTITY_NAME as MILESTONE_NAMEfrom OSS_REF_DATA B, Execution milestone CWhere C.Spec_Id = B.Entity_Id

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
